summary: In Buddhism, a bodhisattva is someone on the journey to becoming a Buddha. They aim to reach awakening (bodhi) and help all living beings. In Theravada Buddhism, bodhisattvas are rare and special, while Mahayana Buddhism teaches that anyone can become one. Mahayana bodhisattvas are known for their compassion and heroic efforts to help others. They possess special qualities like loving-kindness, compassion, and wisdom. Some famous bodhisattvas are Avalokiteshvara, Maitreya, and Manjushri, who are revered for their magical powers and dedication to helping all beings.
title: Bodhisattva
